rip.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
rip.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Her clothes had all been ripped.
The sails ripped under the force of the wind.
Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open.
rip.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to remove something quickly and violently, using your hands
rip.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Gilly ripped out a sheet of paper from her notebook.
The buttons had been ripped off.
rip.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to copy music from a CD to an MP3 player or computer
rip.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: a green leather jacket with a rip in the sleeve
rip.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: the abbreviation of Rest in Peace, written on a  gravestone
